Package fr.univlille.iutinfo.utils

Class Subject

java.lang.Object
fr.univlille.iutinfo.utils.Subject
Direct Known Subclasses:
Game
public abstract class Subject extends Object
A Subject represents an abstract class that serves as the basis for implementing the observer pattern.

Subclasses of Subject can register themselves as observers and notify all registered observers when a change occurs.

  • Field Summary

    Field
    Description
    protected List<Observer>
    attached

  • Field Details

    • attached

      protected List<Observer> attached
      The list of observers attached to the subject.

  • Constructor Details

    • Subject

      protected Subject()
      Creates a new instance of the Subject class. This constructor initializes an empty ArrayList of attached objects.

  • Method Details

    • attach

      public void attach(Observer obs)
      Attaches an Observer object to this subject. If the Observer object is not already attached, it is added to the list of attached objects.
      Parameters:
      obs - The Observer object to be attached to this subject

    • detach

      public void detach(Observer obs)
      Detaches an Observer object from this subject. If the Observer object is attached, it is removed from the list of attached objects.
      Parameters:
      obs - The Observer object to be detached from this subject

    • notifyObservers

      protected void notifyObservers()
      Notifies all attached Observer objects that a change has occurred in this subject. Calls the update() method on each attached Observer object.

      This method iterates through the list of attached Observer objects and calls the update() method on each one, passing this subject as the argument.

      Note: The attached Observer objects should implement the Observer interface and define the update() method.

      See Also:
      • Observer
      • Observer.update(Subject)

    • notifyObservers

      protected void notifyObservers(Object data)
      Notifies all attached Observer objects that a change has occurred in this subject, with the provided data. Calls the update() method on each attached Observer object, passing this subject and the provided data as arguments.

      This method iterates through the list of attached Observer objects and calls the update() method on each one, passing this subject and the provided data as arguments.

      Note: The attached Observer objects should implement the Observer interface and define the update() method that accepts two arguments: the Subject object and the data object.

      Parameters:
      data - the data associated with the change in this subject
      See Also:
      • Observer
      • Observer.update(Subject, Object)
